title: A1990 820-010-41-A no power
message:
Hi,
I have an A1990 820-010-41-A that came to me two weeks ago with no power, that had one CD315 burnt. I replaced the CD3215, and the mac started working again, with no other problem.

Then, after a few days, the client reported that the mac stoped charging the battery, and now it doesn't power on at all. The metter only shows 5V, on all ports, and the ampmeter doesn't reboot on any port (steady 5V on all ports).

Can you help?

title: A1990 820-010-41-A no power
message:
Which voltages do you get on the board?
Did you check any signal from power on sequence?

title: A1990 820-010-41-A no power
message:
HI,
I didn't check the power on sequence, but on the fuses I get 5V.
I thought that maybe it was already a known problem... I'll measure them

title: A1990 820-010-41-A no power
message:
There could be several reasons to get it stuck in 5V input.
We need some readings from the board...

title: A1990 820-010-41-A no power
message:
You're right. Sorry

F3000 = 5V both pins

I stopped here (PPBUS_G3H) because i don't understand those measures, and don't know exactly what to do next :

On two ports I get:
PPBUS_G3H =  oscillates between 7 and 11V

And on the other 2 ports I get
PPBUS_G3H = = 3.2V

I get different values on several rails, depending on witch port i connect the power

title: A1990 820-010-41-A no power
message:
If you get different behaviour, depending which USB-C port is powered on, then you have a problem on the USB-C area.
Try to reflow, or change again that CD3215 chip.

title: A1990 820-010-41-A no power
message:
Hi,
I've replaced the CD3215, but the problem remains the same.  PPBUS_G3H with the same measurements than before

title: A1990 820-010-41-A no power
message: So, still not same behaviour on all USB-C ports?

title: A1990 820-010-41-A no power
message:
Yes, still differente values deppending on the port powered on.

PPBUS_G3H  has 3.1V or 7~11 deppending on the port connected

title: A1990 820-010-41-A no power
message: What about R7020 voltage?

title: A1990 820-010-41-A no power
message:
Hi,
On  R7020  I have 0V on all 4 pads.
But now, the metter reboots on 3 ports. I suppose that  the CD3215 controlling the port that has steady 5V, is the one causing the problem. Correct? How can I be sure?

title: A1990 820-010-41-A no power
message:
In theory that port has problems.
But you should get voltage at R7020.
U7000 requires at least 5V input.
Check diode mode to ground there.

title: A1990 820-010-41-A no power
message:
Diode on  R7020 is OK (0,507V) on all pads.
when connected on the ports that reboots the metter, i get 0.3 ~0.5V on R7020  PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR

title: A1990 820-010-41-A no power
message:
Did you properly measure voltage at R7020?
Use R7071 as test point.

title: A1990 820-010-41-A no power
message: Yes, on R7071, the values are the same (diode and voltage), with the difference that the voltage oscilates a bit higher (0.3 ~0.9V), and one time it reached (very, very  quickly 2V and then continuated to oscilate from 0.3 to 0.7V))

title: A1990 820-010-41-A no power
message:
Then you have a common problem for all USB-C ports; at least one should get 5V at R7020.
Check all input fuses, near CD3215 chips.

title: A1990 820-010-41-A no power
message: I didn't measured R7020 with all USB-C ports. Only with one that is rebooting the metter. Shall i measure R7020 on all ports connected? On the fuses i get 0~5V (rebooting) and steady 5V on the steady port.

title: A1990 820-010-41-A no power
message: Check R7020 with each USB-C port powered.

title: A1990 820-010-41-A no power
message: The measures are the same on all ports, except when connected to the steady 5V port. On that one, i get 0V (0.0003V)on all pads of R7020

title: A1990 820-010-41-A no power
message:
"The measures are the same on all ports"
Yeah, but 0V, or 5V on these 3 ports?

title: A1990 820-010-41-A no power
message: On each of those 3 ports (rebooting ones), the voltages oscilates between 0.3V and 0.9V, and one time it reached (very, very quickly 2V and then continuated to oscilate from 0.3V to 0.9V

title: A1990 820-010-41-A no power
message:
You still have problems on USB-C areas.
Check diode mode to ground on all LDO outputs of CD3215 chips.

title: A1990 820-010-41-A no power
message:
U3100:
PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC = 0.535V
PP1V8_UPC_XA_LDOD = 0.496V
PP1V8_UPC_XA_LDOA =  0.538V
PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO = 0.520V

U3200:
PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO_BMC = 0.540V
PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOD = 0.504V
PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOA =  0.544V
PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO = 0.521V

UB300:
PP1V1_UPC_TA_LDO_BMC = 0.529V
PP1V8_UPC_TA_LDOD = 0.0671V

I think that the short is here. Shall I remove UB300?

title: A1990 820-010-41-A no power
message:
1V8 LDOD is very low on UB300, change the chip.
Don't forget to check UB400 at the end too.

title: A1990 820-010-41-A no power
message:
Sorry for the delay, but I had a flood in the store and this has been very difficult. I only replaced it today, and It turned out, it was the  UB300  damaged.
It's working again.
Thanks!
